article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 71, Detroit 65
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- J.R. Blount had 23 points and Leon Young added 19 off the bench as Loyola of Chicago used a flurry of late free throws for a 71-65 Horizon League victory over Detroit on Thursday night. The Ramblers led by as many as 10 points midway through the second half, but Detroit tied the game at 63 on a 3-pointer by Jon Goode with 2:30 left. Goode led the Titans with a career-high 30 points. Young broke the tie with a pair of free throws with 1:57 left and Blount added another pair with 1:34 remaining. After Goode cut the lead with his final basket of the night with a minute left, Detroit failed to score again. Loyola added four free throws in the final 2.7 seconds when Detroit's Michael Harrington was called for a personal foul and a technical. Young and Blount each added two free throws on that play for the final margin. The victory broke a four-game losing streak for Loyola (6-11, 2-5 Horizon) and was the 11th loss in a row for the Titans (4-13, 0-7). Chris Hayes with 13 was the only Titan besides Goode in double figures.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
